0x00.name: PAGE
0x00.description:
Channel or page currently targeted
for paged communications.
0x00.default: 0x00, read/write, non-paged, not stored in NVM.

0x01.name: OPERATION_0
0x01.description:
Operating mode control. On/off,
margin high and margin low.
0x01.default: 0x80, read/write, paged, stored in user-editable NVM.

0x02.name: ON_OFF_CONFIG_0
0x02.default: 0x1F, read/write, paged, stored in user-editable NVM.

0x03.name: CLEAR_FAULTS
0x03.description:
Clear any fault bits that have been
set.
0x03.default:
Default value not applicable, send byte only, non-paged, not stored in
NVM.

0x05.name: PAGE_PLUS_WRITE
0x05.description:
Write a command directly to a
specified page.
0x05.default: Default value not applicable, write-only, non-paged, not stored in NVM.

0x06.name: PAGE_PLUS_READ
0x06.description:
Read a command directly from a
specified page.
0x06.default: Default value not applicable, read/write, non-paged, not stored in NVM.

0x10.name: WRITE_PROTECT
0x10.description:
Level of protection provided by the
device against accidental changes.
0x10.default: 0x00, read/write, non-paged, stored in user-editable NVM.

0x15.name: STORE_USER_ALL
0x15.description:
Store user operating memory to
EEPROM (user-editable NVM).
0x15.default:
Default value not applicable, send byte only, non-paged, not stored in
NVM.

0x16.name: RESTORE_USER_ALL
0x16.description:
Restore user operating memory
from EEPROM.
0x16.default:
Default value not applicable, send byte only, non-paged, not stored in NVM.
Identical to MFR_RESET command (0xFD).

0x19.name: CAPABILITY
0x19.description:
Summary of PMBus optional
communication protocols
supported by this device.
0x19.default: 0xB0, read-only, non-paged, not stored in NVM.

0x1B.name: SMBALERT_MASK_0
0x1B.default:
Default mask values: STATUS_VOUT_0 =0x00, STATUS_IOUT_0 =0x00,
STATUS_INPUT=0x00, STATUS_TEMPERATURE_0 =0x00, STATUS_
CML=0x00, STATUS_MFR_SPECIFIC_0 =0x11.
Read/write, paged as indicated, 10 bytes total, stored in NVM

0x20.name: VOUT_MODE_0
0x20.default: 0x14 (2^{–12} ), read-only, paged, not stored in NVM.

0x21.name: VOUT_COMMAND_0
0x21.default: 0x1000 (1.000V), read/write, paged, stored in user-editable NVM.

0x24.name: VOUT_MAX_0
0x24.description:
The upper limit on the
commandable output voltage.
0x24.default:
Page 0x00: 0x2000 (2.000V)
Page 0x01: 0x2000 (2.000V)
Read/write, paged, stored in user-editable NVM.

0x25.name: VOUT_MARGIN_HIGH_0
0x25.description:
Margin high output voltage set
point. Must be greater than
VOUT_COMMAND_0 .
0x25.default: 0x10CD (1.050V), read/write, paged, stored in user-editable NVM.

0x26.name: VOUT_MARGIN_LOW_0
0x26.description:
Margin low output voltage set
point. Must be less than
VOUT_COMMAND_0 .
0x26.default: 0x0F33 (0.950V), read/write, paged, stored in user-editable NVM.

0x27.name: VOUT_TRANSITION_RATE_0
0x27.description:
The rate at which the output
voltage changes when VOUT_0 is
commanded to a new value via
I^{2} C.
0x27.default: 0x8042 (0.001V/ms), read/write, paged, stored in user-editable NVM.

0x33.name: FREQUENCY_SWITCH
0x33.default: 0xFBE8 (500kHz), read/write, non-paged, stored in user-editable NVM.

0x35.name: VIN_ON
0x35.default:
0xCAC0 (5.500V), as monitored on the “SV_{IN} ” pin, read/write, non-paged,
stored in user-editable NVM.

0x36.name: VIN_OFF
0x36.default:
0xCAA0 (5.250V) , as monitored on the “SV_{IN} ” pin, read/write, non-paged,
stored in user-editable NVM.

0x38.name: IOUT_CAL_GAIN_0
0x38.description:
The ratio of the voltage at the
control IC’s current-sense pins
to the sensed current, in mΩ, at
25°C.
0x38.default:
Trimmed at ATE, read/write, paged, stored in factory-only NVM. Writes to
this register not recommended.

0x40.name: VOUT_OV_FAULT_LIMIT_0
0x40.default: 0x119A (1.100V), read/write, paged, stored in user-editable NVM.

0x41.name: VOUT_OV_FAULT_RESPONSE_0
0x41.description:
Action to be taken by the device
when an output overvoltage fault
is detected.
0x41.default:
0x7A (20µs glitch filter; non-latching shutdown; autonomous restart upon
fault removal), read/write, paged, stored in user-editable NVM.

0x42.name: VOUT_OV_WARN_LIMIT_0
0x42.default: 0x1133 (1.075V), read/write, paged, stored in user-editable NVM.

0x43.name: VOUT_UV_WARN_LIMIT_0
0x43.default: 0x0ECD (0.925V), read/write, paged, stored in user-editable NVM.

0x44.name: VOUT_UV_FAULT_LIMIT_0
0x44.default: 0x0E66 (0.900V), read/write, paged, stored in user-editable NVM.

0x45.name: VOUT_UV_FAULT_RESPONSE_0
0x45.description:
Action to be taken by the device
when an output undervoltage fault
is detected.
0x45.default:
0xB8 (non-latching shutdown; autonomous restart upon fault removal),
read/write, paged, stored in user-editable NVM.

0x46.name: IOUT_OC_FAULT_LIMIT_0
0x46.description:
Output overcurrent fault threshold
(cycle-by-cycle inductor peak
current).
0x46.default: 0xDB20 (25A), read/write, paged, stored in user-editable NVM.

0x47.name: IOUT_OC_FAULT_RESPONSE_0
0x47.description:
Action to be taken by the device
when an output overcurrent fault
is detected.
0x47.default:
0x00 (try to regulate through the fault condition/event; limit the cycle-by-cycle peak of the inductor current to not exceed the commanded IOUT_
OC_FAULT_LIMIT), read/write, paged, stored in user-editable NVM.

0x4A.name: IOUT_OC_WARN_LIMIT_0
0x4A.description:
Output overcurrent warning
threshold (time-averaged inductor
current).
0x4A.default: 0xDAC0 (22A), read/write, paged, stored in user-editable NVM.

0x4F.name: OT_FAULT_LIMIT_0
0x4F.default: 0xF200 (128°C), read/write, paged, stored in user-editable NVM.

0x50.name: OT_FAULT_RESPONSE_0
0x50.description:
Action to be taken by the device
when an overtemperature fault is
detected via TSNS_{n a} .
0x50.default:
0xB8 (non-latching shutdown; autonomous restart upon fault removal),
read/write, paged, stored in user-editable NVM.

0x51.name: OT_WARN_LIMIT_0
0x51.default: 0xEBE8 (125°C), read/write, paged, stored in user-editable NVM.

0x53.name: UT_FAULT_LIMIT_0
0x53.default: 0xE530 (–45°C), read/write, paged, stored in user-editable NVM.

0x54.name: UT_FAULT_RESPONSE_0
0x54.default:
0x00 (ignore; continue without interruption), read/write, paged, stored in
user-editable NVM, read/write, paged, stored in user-editable NVM.

0x55.name: VIN_OV_FAULT_LIMIT
0x55.default: 0xDA80 (20.0V), read/write, non-paged, stored in user-editable NVM.

0x56.name: VIN_OV_FAULT_RESPONSE_0
0x56.description:
Response to input overvoltage
fault events.
0x56.default:
0xB8 (non-latching shutdown; autonomous restart upon fault removal),
read/write, paged, stored in user-editable NVM.

0x58.name: VIN_UV_WARN_LIMIT
0x58.default: 0xCAA6 (5.297V), read/write, non-paged, stored in user-editable NVM.

0x5D.name: IIN_OC_WARN_LIMIT
0x5D.default: 0xDA00 (16A), read/write, non-paged, stored in user-editable NVM.

0x60.name: TON_DELAY_0
0x60.description:
Time from RUN_0 and/or
OPERATION_0 on to output rail
turn-on.
0x60.default: 0x8000 (0ms), read/write, paged, stored in user-editable NVM.

0x61.name: TON_RISE_0
0x61.description:
Time from when the output
voltage reference starts to rise
until it reaches its commanded
setting.
0x61.default: 0xC300 (3ms), read/write, paged, stored in user-editable NVM.

0x62.name: TON_MAX_FAULT_LIMIT_0
0x62.description:
Turn-on watchdog timeout fault
threshold (time permitted for
VOUT_0 to reach or exceed VOUT_
UV_FAULT_LIMIT_0 after turn-on
command is received).
0x62.default: 0xCA80 (5ms), read/write, paged, stored in user-editable NVM.

0x63.name: TON_MAX_FAULT_RESPONSE_0
0x63.description:
Action to be taken by the device
when a TON_MAX_FAULT_0 event
is detected.
0x63.default:
0xB8 (non-latching shutdown; autonomous restart upon fault removal),
read/write, paged, stored in user-editable NVM.

0x64.name: TOFF_DELAY_0
0x64.description:
Time from RUN and/or Operation
off to the start of TOFF_FALL_0
ramp.
0x64.default: 0x8000 (0ms), read/write, paged, stored in user-editable NVM.

0x65.name: TOFF_FALL_0
0x65.description:
Time from when the output
voltage reference starts to fall until
it reaches 0V.
0x65.default: 0xC300 (3ms), read/write, paged, stored in user-editable NVM.

0x66.name: TOFF_MAX_WARN_LIMIT_0
0x66.description:
Turn-off watchdog timeout fault
threshold (time permitted for
VOUT_0 to decay to or below
12.5% of the commanded VOUT_0
value at the time of receiving a
turn-off command).
0x66.default: 0x8000 (no limit; warning is disabled), read/write, paged, stored in user-editable NVM.

0x78.name: STATUS_BYTE_0
0x78.description:
One byte summary of the unit’s
fault condition.
0x78.default: Default value not applicable, read/write, paged, not stored in NVM.

0x79.name: STATUS_WORD_0
0x79.description:
Two byte summary of the unit’s
fault condition.
0x79.default: Default value not applicable, read/write, paged, not stored in NVM.

0x7A.name: STATUS_VOUT_0
0x7A.description:
Output voltage fault and warning
status.
0x7A.default: Default value not applicable, read/write, paged, not stored in NVM.

0x7B.name: STATUS_IOUT_0
0x7B.description:
Output current fault and warning
status.
0x7B.default: Default value not applicable, read/write, paged, not stored in NVM.

0x7C.name: STATUS_INPUT
0x7C.description:
Input supply (SV_{IN} ) fault and
warning status.
0x7C.default: Default value not applicable, read/write, non-paged, not stored in NVM.

0x7D.name: STATUS_TEMPERATURE_0
0x7D.description:
TSNS_{na} -sensed temperature
fault and warning status for
READ_TEMERATURE_1_0 .
0x7D.default: Default value not applicable, read/write, paged, not stored in NVM.

0x7E.name: STATUS_CML
0x7E.description:
Communication and memory fault
and warning status.
0x7E.default: Default value not applicable, read/write, non-paged, not stored in NVM.

0x80.name: STATUS_MFR_SPECIFIC_0
0x80.description:
Manufacturer specific fault and
state information.
0x80.default: Default value not applicable, read/write, paged, not stored in NVM.

0x88.name: READ_VIN
0x88.default: Default value not applicable, read-only, non-paged, not stored in NVM.

0x89.name: READ_IIN
0x89.default: Default value not applicable, read-only, non-paged, not stored in NVM.

0x8B.name: READ_VOUT_0
0x8B.default: Default value not applicable, read-only, paged, not stored in NVM.

0x8C.name: READ_IOUT_0
0x8C.default: Default value not applicable, read-only, paged, not stored in NVM.

0x8D.name: READ_TEMPERATURE_1_0
0x8D.default: Default value not applicable, read-only, paged, not stored in NVM.

0x8E.name: READ_TEMPERATURE_2
0x8E.default: Default value not applicable, read-only, non-paged, not stored in NVM.

0x94.name: READ_DUTY_CYCLE_0
0x94.default: Default value not applicable, read-only, paged, not stored in NVM.

0x96.name: READ_POUT_0
0x96.default: Default value not applicable, read-only, paged, not stored in NVM.

0x98.name: PMBUS_REVISION
0x98.description:
PMBus revision supported by this
device.
0x98.default:
0x22 (Revision 1.2 of Part I and Revision 1.2 of Part II of PMBus
Specification documents), read-only, non-paged, not stored in NVM.

0x9E.name: MFR_SERIAL
0x9E.description: Serial number of this specific unit.
0x9E.default:
Up to nine bytes of custom-formatted data that identify the unit’s
configuration, read-only, non-paged.

0xA5.name: MFR_VOUT_MAX_0
0xA5.default: 0x5B34 (5.700V) on both channels. Read-only, paged, not stored in user-editable NVM.

0xB0.name: USER_DATA_00
0xB0.default:
Read/write, non-paged, stored in user-editable NVM. Recommended
against altering.

0xB1.name: USER_DATA_01_0
0xB1.default:
Read/write, paged, stored in user-editable NVM. Recommended against
altering.

0xB2.name: USER_DATA_02
0xB2.default:
Read/write, non-paged, stored in user-editable NVM. Recommended
against altering.

0xB3.name: USER_DATA_03_0
0xB3.description:
User-editable words available for
the user.
0xB3.default: 0x0000, read/write, paged, stored in user-editable NVM.

0xB4.name: USER_DATA_04
0xB4.description:
A user-editable word available for
the user.
0xB4.default: 0x0000, read/write, non-paged, stored in user-editable NVM.

0xB6.name: MFR_INFO
0xB6.default:
Default value not applicable, read only, non-paged, not stored in NVM.
Bit 5 is 0_{b} when ECC has made a correction to data derived from the
EEPROM user space.

0xBD.name: MFR_EE_UNLOCK
0xBD.description:
Unlock user EEPROM for access
by MFR_EE_ERASE and MFR_EE_
DATA commands.
0xBD.default: Default value not applicable, read/write, non-paged, not stored in NVM.

0xBE.name: MFR_EE_ERASE
0xBE.description:
Initialize user EEPROM for bulk
programming by MFR_EE_DATA.
0xBE.default: Default value not applicable, read/write, non-paged, not stored in NVM.

0xBF.name: MFR_EE_DATA
0xBF.description:
Data transferred to and from
EEPROM using sequential PMBus
word reads or writes. Supports
bulk programming.
0xBF.default: Default value not applicable, read/write, non-paged, not stored in NVM.

0xD0.name: MFR_CHAN_CONFIG_*_0
0xD0.default:
0x1F, read/write, paged, stored in user-editable NVM. Register is named
“MFR_CHAN_CONFIG” and referred to as “MFR_CHAN_CONFIG_
LTM467X” in LTpowerPlay.

0xD1.name: MFR_CONFIG_ALL_*
0xD1.description:
Global configuration bits, i.e.,
common to both V_{OUT} channels
0 and 1.
0xD1.default:
0x09, read/write, non-paged, stored in user-editable NVM. Bit 4 configures
whether the SYNC drive circuit is active (0_{b} ) or inactive (1_{b} ); Bit 3
configures whether the Stuck PMBus Timer Timeout is 150ms for Block
Reads and 32ms for Non-Block Reads (0_{b} ) or 250ms for all Reads (1_{b} ).

0xD2.name: MFR_GPIO_PROPAGATE_*_0
0xD2.description:
Configuration bits for propagating
faults to the GPIO_0 pins.
0xD2.default:
0x6893, read/write, paged, stored in user-editable NVM. Register is
named “MFR_GPIO_PROPAGATE” and referred to as “MFR_GPIO_
PROPAGATE_LTM467X” in LTpowerPlay.

0xD4.name: MFR_PWM_MODE_*_0
0xD4.description:
Configuration for the PWM engine
of each V_{OUT} channel.
0xD4.default:
0xC3, read/write, paged, stored in user-editable NVM. Bit 1 commands
whether the output is in high range (0_{b} ) or low range (1_{b} ). Bit 0
commands whether the output is operating in Forced Continuous
Conduction Mode (1_{b} ) or Discontinuous Mode (0_{b} ).
Command is named MFR_PWM_MODE and referred to as MFR_PWM_
MODE_LTM467X in LTpowerPlay.

0xD5.name: MFR_GPIO_RESPONSE_0
0xD5.description:
Action to be taken by the device
when the GPIO_0 pin is asserted
low by circuitry external to the
unit.
0xD5.default:
0xC0 (make the respective output’s power stage high impedance, i.e.,
three-stated; autonomous restart upon fault removal),
read/write, paged, stored in user-editable NVM.

0xD6.name: MFR_OT_FAULT_RESPONSE
0xD6.description:
Action to be taken by the device
when a control IC junction
overtemperature fault is detected.
0xD6.default:
0xC0 (make the respective output’s power stage high impedance, i.e.,
three-stated; autonomous restart upon fault removal), read-only, non-paged, not stored in user-editable NVM.

0xD7.name: MFR_IOUT_PEAK_0
0xD7.description:
Maximum measured value of
READ_IOUT_0 since the last
MFR_CLEAR_PEAKS.
0xD7.default: Default value not applicable, read-only, paged, not stored in NVM.

0xD8.name: MFR_ADC_CONTROL
0xD8.description:
ADC telemetry parameter for
repeated fast ADC readback.
0xD8.default:
0x00, read/write, not paged, not stored in NVM. Allows telemetry
readback rates up to 125Hz instead of 10Hz, nominal.

0xDA.name: MFR_ADC_TELEMETRY_STATUS
0xDA.default:
Default value not applicable, read/write, not paged, not stored in NVM.
ADC status indicating most recently digitized telemetry when engaged in
short round-robin loop (MFR_ADC_CONTROL=0x0D)

0xDB.name: MFR_RETRY_DELAY_0
0xDB.default: 0xF3E8 (250ms), read/write, paged, stored in user-editable NVM.

0xDC.name: MFR_RESTART_DELAY_0
0xDC.description:
Minimum interval (nominal) the
RUN_0 pin is pulled logic low by
internal circuitry.
0xDC.default: 0xFA58 (300ms), read/write, paged, stored in user-editable NVM.

0xDD.name: MFR_VOUT_PEAK_0
0xDD.description:
Maximum measured value of
READ_VOUT_0 since the last
MFR_CLEAR_PEAKS.
0xDD.default: Default value not applicable, read-only, paged, not stored in NVM.

0xDE.name: MFR_VIN_PEAK
0xDE.description:
Maximum measured value
of READ_VIN since the last
MFR_CLEAR_PEAKS.
0xDE.default: Default value not applicable, read-only, non-paged, not stored in NVM.

0xDF.name: MFR_TEMPERATURE_1_PEAK_0
0xDF.default: Default value not applicable, read-only, paged, not stored in NVM.

0xE3.name: MFR_CLEAR_PEAKS
0xE3.default:
Default value not applicable, send byte only, non-paged, not stored in
NVM.

0xE5.name: MFR_PADS
0xE5.description: Digital status of the I/O pads.
0xE5.default: Default value not applicable, read-only, non-paged, not stored in NVM.

0xE6.name: MFR_ADDRESS
0xE6.description:
LTM4677 I^{2} C slave address,
right-justified.
0xE6.default:
0x4F, read/write, non-paged, stored in user-editable NVM. Bits[6:4]
represent the user-configurable upper 3 bits of the 7-bit slave address of
the device. Bits[3:0] are dictated by the ASEL resistor pin-strap setting.
Setting this command to 0x80 disables device-specific addressing.

0xE7.name: MFR_SPECIAL_ID
0xE7.description:
Manufacturer code representing IC
silicon and revision

0xE9.name: MFR_IIN_OFFSET_0
0xE9.description:
Coefficient used in calculations of
READ_IIN and MFR_READ_IIN_0 ,
representing the contribution of
input current drawn by the control
IC, including the MOSFET drivers.
0xE9.default: 0x8BE7 (0.0305A), read/write, paged, stored in user-editable NVM.

0xEA.name: MFR_FAULT_LOG_STORE
0xEA.description:
Commands a transfer of the fault
log from RAM to EEPROM. This
causes the part to behave as if a
channel has faulted off.
0xEA.default:
Default value not applicable, send byte only, non-paged, not stored in
NVM.

0xEC.name: MFR_FAULT_LOG_CLEAR
0xEC.description:
Initialize the EEPROM block
reserved for fault logging and
clear any previous fault logging
locks.
0xEC.default:
Default value not applicable, send byte only, non-paged, not stored in
NVM.

0xED.name: MFR_READ_IIN_0
0xED.default: Default value not applicable, read-only, paged, not stored in NVM.

0xEE.name: MFR_FAULT_LOG
0xEE.description:
Fault log data bytes. This
sequentially retrieved data is used
to assemble a complete fault log.
0xEE.default:
Default value not applicable, read-only, non-paged, stored in fault-log
NVM.

0xEF.name: MFR_COMMON
0xEF.description:
Manufacturer status bits that are
common across multiple ADI ICs/
modules.
0xEF.default: Default value not applicable, read-only, non-paged, not stored in NVM.

0xF0.name: MFR_COMPARE_USER_ALL
0xF0.description:
Compares current command
contents (RAM) with NVM.
0xF0.default:
Default value not applicable, send byte only, non-paged, not stored in
NVM.

0xF4.name: MFR_TEMPERATURE_2_PEAK
0xF4.description:
Maximum measured control IC
junction temperature since last
MFR_CLEAR_PEAKS.
0xF4.default: Default value not applicable, read-only, non-paged, not stored in NVM.

0xF5.name: MFR_PWM_CONFIG_*
0xF5.description:
Configuration bits for setting
the phase interleaving angles of
Channels 0 and 1, SHARE_CLK
behavior in UVLO, and using
the fully differential amplifier
to regulate paralleled output
channels.
0xF5.default:
0x10, read/write, non-paged, stored in user-editable NVM. When bit 7 is
0_{b} , Channel 1's output is regulated by the V_{OSNS1} and SGND feedback
signals. When bit 7 is 1_{b} , Channel 1's output is regulated by the V_{OSNS0} +
and V_{OSNS0} – feedback signals. Only set bit 7 to 1_{b} for PolyPhase rail
applications. The command is named MFR_PWM_CONFIG and referred to
as MFR_PWM_CONFIG_LTM467X in LTpowerPlay.

0xF6.name: MFR_IOUT_CAL_GAIN_TC_0
0xF6.description:
Temperature coefficient of the
current sensing element.
0xF6.default: 0x0F14 (3860ppm/°C), read/write, paged, stored in user-editable NVM.

0xF8.name: MFR_TEMP_1_GAIN_0
0xF8.description:
Sets the slope of the temperature
sensors that interface to TSNS_{na} .
0xF8.default:
0x3FAE (0.995, in custom units), read/write, paged, stored in user-editable
NVM.

0xF9.name: MFR_TEMP_1_OFFSET_0

0xFA.name: MFR_RAIL_ADDRESS_0
0xFA.description:
Common address for PolyPhase
outputs to adjust common
parameters.

0xFD.name: MFR_RESET
0xFD.description:
Commanded reset without
requiring a power down.
0xFD.default:
Default value not applicable, send byte only, non-paged, not stored in
NVM. Identical to RESTORE_USER_ALL.

0x00.name: PAGE
0x00.description:
Channel or page currently targeted
for paged communications.
0x00.default: 0x00, read/write, non-paged, not stored in NVM.

0x01.name: OPERATION_1
0x01.description:
Operating mode control. On/off,
margin high and margin low.
0x01.default: 0x80, read/write, paged, stored in user-editable NVM.

0x02.name: ON_OFF_CONFIG_1
0x02.default: 0x1F, read/write, paged, stored in user-editable NVM.

0x03.name: CLEAR_FAULTS
0x03.description:
Clear any fault bits that have been
set.
0x03.default:
Default value not applicable, send byte only, non-paged, not stored in
NVM.

0x05.name: PAGE_PLUS_WRITE
0x05.description:
Write a command directly to a
specified page.
0x05.default: Default value not applicable, write-only, non-paged, not stored in NVM.

0x06.name: PAGE_PLUS_READ
0x06.description:
Read a command directly from a
specified page.
0x06.default: Default value not applicable, read/write, non-paged, not stored in NVM.

0x10.name: WRITE_PROTECT
0x10.description:
Level of protection provided by the
device against accidental changes.
0x10.default: 0x00, read/write, non-paged, stored in user-editable NVM.

0x15.name: STORE_USER_ALL
0x15.description:
Store user operating memory to
EEPROM (user-editable NVM).
0x15.default:
Default value not applicable, send byte only, non-paged, not stored in
NVM.

0x16.name: RESTORE_USER_ALL
0x16.description:
Restore user operating memory
from EEPROM.
0x16.default:
Default value not applicable, send byte only, non-paged, not stored in NVM.
Identical to MFR_RESET command (0xFD).

0x19.name: CAPABILITY
0x19.description:
Summary of PMBus optional
communication protocols
supported by this device.
0x19.default: 0xB0, read-only, non-paged, not stored in NVM.

0x1B.name: SMBALERT_MASK_1
0x1B.default:
Default mask values: STATUS_VOUT_1 =0x00, STATUS_IOUT_1 =0x00,
STATUS_INPUT=0x00, STATUS_TEMPERATURE_1 =0x00, STATUS_
CML=0x00, STATUS_MFR_SPECIFIC_1 =0x11.
Read/write, paged as indicated, 10 bytes total, stored in NVM

0x20.name: VOUT_MODE_1
0x20.default: 0x14 (2^{–12} ), read-only, paged, not stored in NVM.

0x21.name: VOUT_COMMAND_1
0x21.default: 0x1000 (1.000V), read/write, paged, stored in user-editable NVM.

0x24.name: VOUT_MAX_1
0x24.description:
The upper limit on the
commandable output voltage.
0x24.default:
Page 0x00: 0x2000 (2.000V)
Page 0x01: 0x2000 (2.000V)
Read/write, paged, stored in user-editable NVM.

0x25.name: VOUT_MARGIN_HIGH_1
0x25.description:
Margin high output voltage set
point. Must be greater than
VOUT_COMMAND_1 .
0x25.default: 0x10CD (1.050V), read/write, paged, stored in user-editable NVM.

0x26.name: VOUT_MARGIN_LOW_1
0x26.description:
Margin low output voltage set
point. Must be less than
VOUT_COMMAND_1 .
0x26.default: 0x0F33 (0.950V), read/write, paged, stored in user-editable NVM.

0x27.name: VOUT_TRANSITION_RATE_1
0x27.description:
The rate at which the output
voltage changes when VOUT_1 is
commanded to a new value via
I^{2} C.
0x27.default: 0x8042 (0.001V/ms), read/write, paged, stored in user-editable NVM.

0x33.name: FREQUENCY_SWITCH
0x33.default: 0xFBE8 (500kHz), read/write, non-paged, stored in user-editable NVM.

0x35.name: VIN_ON
0x35.default:
0xCAC0 (5.500V), as monitored on the “SV_{IN} ” pin, read/write, non-paged,
stored in user-editable NVM.

0x36.name: VIN_OFF
0x36.default:
0xCAA0 (5.250V) , as monitored on the “SV_{IN} ” pin, read/write, non-paged,
stored in user-editable NVM.

0x38.name: IOUT_CAL_GAIN_1
0x38.description:
The ratio of the voltage at the
control IC’s current-sense pins
to the sensed current, in mΩ, at
25°C.
0x38.default:
Trimmed at ATE, read/write, paged, stored in factory-only NVM. Writes to
this register not recommended.

0x40.name: VOUT_OV_FAULT_LIMIT_1
0x40.default: 0x119A (1.100V), read/write, paged, stored in user-editable NVM.

0x41.name: VOUT_OV_FAULT_RESPONSE_1
0x41.description:
Action to be taken by the device
when an output overvoltage fault
is detected.
0x41.default:
0x7A (20µs glitch filter; non-latching shutdown; autonomous restart upon
fault removal), read/write, paged, stored in user-editable NVM.

0x42.name: VOUT_OV_WARN_LIMIT_1
0x42.default: 0x1133 (1.075V), read/write, paged, stored in user-editable NVM.

0x43.name: VOUT_UV_WARN_LIMIT_1
0x43.default: 0x0ECD (0.925V), read/write, paged, stored in user-editable NVM.

0x44.name: VOUT_UV_FAULT_LIMIT_1
0x44.default: 0x0E66 (0.900V), read/write, paged, stored in user-editable NVM.

0x45.name: VOUT_UV_FAULT_RESPONSE_1
0x45.description:
Action to be taken by the device
when an output undervoltage fault
is detected.
0x45.default:
0xB8 (non-latching shutdown; autonomous restart upon fault removal),
read/write, paged, stored in user-editable NVM.

0x46.name: IOUT_OC_FAULT_LIMIT_1
0x46.description:
Output overcurrent fault threshold
(cycle-by-cycle inductor peak
current).
0x46.default: 0xDB20 (25A), read/write, paged, stored in user-editable NVM.

0x47.name: IOUT_OC_FAULT_RESPONSE_1
0x47.description:
Action to be taken by the device
when an output overcurrent fault
is detected.
0x47.default:
0x00 (try to regulate through the fault condition/event; limit the cycle-by-cycle peak of the inductor current to not exceed the commanded IOUT_
OC_FAULT_LIMIT), read/write, paged, stored in user-editable NVM.

0x4A.name: IOUT_OC_WARN_LIMIT_1
0x4A.description:
Output overcurrent warning
threshold (time-averaged inductor
current).
0x4A.default: 0xDAC0 (22A), read/write, paged, stored in user-editable NVM.

0x4F.name: OT_FAULT_LIMIT_1
0x4F.default: 0xF200 (128°C), read/write, paged, stored in user-editable NVM.

0x50.name: OT_FAULT_RESPONSE_1
0x50.description:
Action to be taken by the device
when an overtemperature fault is
detected via TSNS_{n a} .
0x50.default:
0xB8 (non-latching shutdown; autonomous restart upon fault removal),
read/write, paged, stored in user-editable NVM.

0x51.name: OT_WARN_LIMIT_1
0x51.default: 0xEBE8 (125°C), read/write, paged, stored in user-editable NVM.

0x53.name: UT_FAULT_LIMIT_1
0x53.default: 0xE530 (–45°C), read/write, paged, stored in user-editable NVM.

0x54.name: UT_FAULT_RESPONSE_1
0x54.default:
0x00 (ignore; continue without interruption), read/write, paged, stored in
user-editable NVM, read/write, paged, stored in user-editable NVM.

0x55.name: VIN_OV_FAULT_LIMIT
0x55.default: 0xDA80 (20.0V), read/write, non-paged, stored in user-editable NVM.

0x56.name: VIN_OV_FAULT_RESPONSE_1
0x56.description:
Response to input overvoltage
fault events.
0x56.default:
0xB8 (non-latching shutdown; autonomous restart upon fault removal),
read/write, paged, stored in user-editable NVM.

0x58.name: VIN_UV_WARN_LIMIT
0x58.default: 0xCAA6 (5.297V), read/write, non-paged, stored in user-editable NVM.

0x5D.name: IIN_OC_WARN_LIMIT
0x5D.default: 0xDA00 (16A), read/write, non-paged, stored in user-editable NVM.

0x60.name: TON_DELAY_1
0x60.description:
Time from RUN_1 and/or
OPERATION_1 on to output rail
turn-on.
0x60.default: 0x8000 (0ms), read/write, paged, stored in user-editable NVM.

0x61.name: TON_RISE_1
0x61.description:
Time from when the output
voltage reference starts to rise
until it reaches its commanded
setting.
0x61.default: 0xC300 (3ms), read/write, paged, stored in user-editable NVM.

0x62.name: TON_MAX_FAULT_LIMIT_1
0x62.description:
Turn-on watchdog timeout fault
threshold (time permitted for
VOUT_1 to reach or exceed VOUT_
UV_FAULT_LIMIT_1 after turn-on
command is received).
0x62.default: 0xCA80 (5ms), read/write, paged, stored in user-editable NVM.

0x63.name: TON_MAX_FAULT_RESPONSE_1
0x63.description:
Action to be taken by the device
when a TON_MAX_FAULT_1 event
is detected.
0x63.default:
0xB8 (non-latching shutdown; autonomous restart upon fault removal),
read/write, paged, stored in user-editable NVM.

0x64.name: TOFF_DELAY_1
0x64.description:
Time from RUN and/or Operation
off to the start of TOFF_FALL_1
ramp.
0x64.default: 0x8000 (0ms), read/write, paged, stored in user-editable NVM.

0x65.name: TOFF_FALL_1
0x65.description:
Time from when the output
voltage reference starts to fall until
it reaches 0V.
0x65.default: 0xC300 (3ms), read/write, paged, stored in user-editable NVM.

0x66.name: TOFF_MAX_WARN_LIMIT_1
0x66.description:
Turn-off watchdog timeout fault
threshold (time permitted for
VOUT_1 to decay to or below
12.5% of the commanded VOUT_1
value at the time of receiving a
turn-off command).
0x66.default: 0x8000 (no limit; warning is disabled), read/write, paged, stored in user-editable NVM.

0x78.name: STATUS_BYTE_1
0x78.description:
One byte summary of the unit’s
fault condition.
0x78.default: Default value not applicable, read/write, paged, not stored in NVM.

0x79.name: STATUS_WORD_1
0x79.description:
Two byte summary of the unit’s
fault condition.
0x79.default: Default value not applicable, read/write, paged, not stored in NVM.

0x7A.name: STATUS_VOUT_1
0x7A.description:
Output voltage fault and warning
status.
0x7A.default: Default value not applicable, read/write, paged, not stored in NVM.

0x7B.name: STATUS_IOUT_1
0x7B.description:
Output current fault and warning
status.
0x7B.default: Default value not applicable, read/write, paged, not stored in NVM.

0x7C.name: STATUS_INPUT
0x7C.description:
Input supply (SV_{IN} ) fault and
warning status.
0x7C.default: Default value not applicable, read/write, non-paged, not stored in NVM.

0x7D.name: STATUS_TEMPERATURE_1
0x7D.description:
TSNS_{na} -sensed temperature
fault and warning status for
READ_TEMERATURE_1_1 .
0x7D.default: Default value not applicable, read/write, paged, not stored in NVM.

0x7E.name: STATUS_CML
0x7E.description:
Communication and memory fault
and warning status.
0x7E.default: Default value not applicable, read/write, non-paged, not stored in NVM.

0x80.name: STATUS_MFR_SPECIFIC_1
0x80.description:
Manufacturer specific fault and
state information.
0x80.default: Default value not applicable, read/write, paged, not stored in NVM.

0x88.name: READ_VIN
0x88.default: Default value not applicable, read-only, non-paged, not stored in NVM.

0x89.name: READ_IIN
0x89.default: Default value not applicable, read-only, non-paged, not stored in NVM.

0x8B.name: READ_VOUT_1
0x8B.default: Default value not applicable, read-only, paged, not stored in NVM.

0x8C.name: READ_IOUT_1
0x8C.default: Default value not applicable, read-only, paged, not stored in NVM.

0x8D.name: READ_TEMPERATURE_1_1
0x8D.default: Default value not applicable, read-only, paged, not stored in NVM.

0x8E.name: READ_TEMPERATURE_2
0x8E.default: Default value not applicable, read-only, non-paged, not stored in NVM.

0x94.name: READ_DUTY_CYCLE_1
0x94.default: Default value not applicable, read-only, paged, not stored in NVM.

0x96.name: READ_POUT_1
0x96.default: Default value not applicable, read-only, paged, not stored in NVM.

0x98.name: PMBUS_REVISION
0x98.description:
PMBus revision supported by this
device.
0x98.default:
0x22 (Revision 1.2 of Part I and Revision 1.2 of Part II of PMBus
Specification documents), read-only, non-paged, not stored in NVM.

0x9E.name: MFR_SERIAL
0x9E.description: Serial number of this specific unit.
0x9E.default:
Up to nine bytes of custom-formatted data that identify the unit’s
configuration, read-only, non-paged.

0xA5.name: MFR_VOUT_MAX_1
0xA5.default: 0x5B34 (5.700V) on both channels. Read-only, paged, not stored in user-editable NVM.

0xB0.name: USER_DATA_00
0xB0.default:
Read/write, non-paged, stored in user-editable NVM. Recommended
against altering.

0xB1.name: USER_DATA_01_1
0xB1.default:
Read/write, paged, stored in user-editable NVM. Recommended against
altering.

0xB2.name: USER_DATA_02
0xB2.default:
Read/write, non-paged, stored in user-editable NVM. Recommended
against altering.

0xB3.name: USER_DATA_03_1
0xB3.description:
User-editable words available for
the user.
0xB3.default: 0x0000, read/write, paged, stored in user-editable NVM.

0xB4.name: USER_DATA_04
0xB4.description:
A user-editable word available for
the user.
0xB4.default: 0x0000, read/write, non-paged, stored in user-editable NVM.

0xB6.name: MFR_INFO
0xB6.default:
Default value not applicable, read only, non-paged, not stored in NVM.
Bit 5 is 0_{b} when ECC has made a correction to data derived from the
EEPROM user space.

0xBD.name: MFR_EE_UNLOCK
0xBD.description:
Unlock user EEPROM for access
by MFR_EE_ERASE and MFR_EE_
DATA commands.
0xBD.default: Default value not applicable, read/write, non-paged, not stored in NVM.

0xBE.name: MFR_EE_ERASE
0xBE.description:
Initialize user EEPROM for bulk
programming by MFR_EE_DATA.
0xBE.default: Default value not applicable, read/write, non-paged, not stored in NVM.

0xBF.name: MFR_EE_DATA
0xBF.description:
Data transferred to and from
EEPROM using sequential PMBus
word reads or writes. Supports
bulk programming.
0xBF.default: Default value not applicable, read/write, non-paged, not stored in NVM.

0xD0.name: MFR_CHAN_CONFIG_*_1
0xD0.default:
0x1F, read/write, paged, stored in user-editable NVM. Register is named
“MFR_CHAN_CONFIG” and referred to as “MFR_CHAN_CONFIG_
LTM467X” in LTpowerPlay.

0xD1.name: MFR_CONFIG_ALL_*
0xD1.description:
Global configuration bits, i.e.,
common to both V_{OUT} channels
0 and 1.
0xD1.default:
0x09, read/write, non-paged, stored in user-editable NVM. Bit 4 configures
whether the SYNC drive circuit is active (0_{b} ) or inactive (1_{b} ); Bit 3
configures whether the Stuck PMBus Timer Timeout is 150ms for Block
Reads and 32ms for Non-Block Reads (0_{b} ) or 250ms for all Reads (1_{b} ).

0xD2.name: MFR_GPIO_PROPAGATE_*_1
0xD2.description:
Configuration bits for propagating
faults to the GPIO_1 pins.
0xD2.default:
0x6893, read/write, paged, stored in user-editable NVM. Register is
named “MFR_GPIO_PROPAGATE” and referred to as “MFR_GPIO_
PROPAGATE_LTM467X” in LTpowerPlay.

0xD4.name: MFR_PWM_MODE_*_1
0xD4.description:
Configuration for the PWM engine
of each V_{OUT} channel.
0xD4.default:
0xC3, read/write, paged, stored in user-editable NVM. Bit 1 commands
whether the output is in high range (0_{b} ) or low range (1_{b} ). Bit 0
commands whether the output is operating in Forced Continuous
Conduction Mode (1_{b} ) or Discontinuous Mode (0_{b} ).
Command is named MFR_PWM_MODE and referred to as MFR_PWM_
MODE_LTM467X in LTpowerPlay.

0xD5.name: MFR_GPIO_RESPONSE_1
0xD5.description:
Action to be taken by the device
when the GPIO_1 pin is asserted
low by circuitry external to the
unit.
0xD5.default:
0xC0 (make the respective output’s power stage high impedance, i.e.,
three-stated; autonomous restart upon fault removal),
read/write, paged, stored in user-editable NVM.

0xD6.name: MFR_OT_FAULT_RESPONSE
0xD6.description:
Action to be taken by the device
when a control IC junction
overtemperature fault is detected.
0xD6.default:
0xC0 (make the respective output’s power stage high impedance, i.e.,
three-stated; autonomous restart upon fault removal), read-only, non-paged, not stored in user-editable NVM.

0xD7.name: MFR_IOUT_PEAK_1
0xD7.description:
Maximum measured value of
READ_IOUT_1 since the last
MFR_CLEAR_PEAKS.
0xD7.default: Default value not applicable, read-only, paged, not stored in NVM.

0xD8.name: MFR_ADC_CONTROL
0xD8.description:
ADC telemetry parameter for
repeated fast ADC readback.
0xD8.default:
0x00, read/write, not paged, not stored in NVM. Allows telemetry
readback rates up to 125Hz instead of 10Hz, nominal.

0xDA.name: MFR_ADC_TELEMETRY_STATUS
0xDA.default:
Default value not applicable, read/write, not paged, not stored in NVM.
ADC status indicating most recently digitized telemetry when engaged in
short round-robin loop (MFR_ADC_CONTROL=0x0D)

0xDB.name: MFR_RETRY_DELAY_1
0xDB.default: 0xF3E8 (250ms), read/write, paged, stored in user-editable NVM.

0xDC.name: MFR_RESTART_DELAY_1
0xDC.description:
Minimum interval (nominal) the
RUN_1 pin is pulled logic low by
internal circuitry.
0xDC.default: 0xFA58 (300ms), read/write, paged, stored in user-editable NVM.

0xDD.name: MFR_VOUT_PEAK_1
0xDD.description:
Maximum measured value of
READ_VOUT_1 since the last
MFR_CLEAR_PEAKS.
0xDD.default: Default value not applicable, read-only, paged, not stored in NVM.

0xDE.name: MFR_VIN_PEAK
0xDE.description:
Maximum measured value
of READ_VIN since the last
MFR_CLEAR_PEAKS.
0xDE.default: Default value not applicable, read-only, non-paged, not stored in NVM.

0xDF.name: MFR_TEMPERATURE_1_PEAK_1
0xDF.default: Default value not applicable, read-only, paged, not stored in NVM.

0xE3.name: MFR_CLEAR_PEAKS
0xE3.default:
Default value not applicable, send byte only, non-paged, not stored in
NVM.

0xE5.name: MFR_PADS
0xE5.description: Digital status of the I/O pads.
0xE5.default: Default value not applicable, read-only, non-paged, not stored in NVM.

0xE6.name: MFR_ADDRESS
0xE6.description:
LTM4677 I^{2} C slave address,
right-justified.
0xE6.default:
0x4F, read/write, non-paged, stored in user-editable NVM. Bits[6:4]
represent the user-configurable upper 3 bits of the 7-bit slave address of
the device. Bits[3:0] are dictated by the ASEL resistor pin-strap setting.
Setting this command to 0x80 disables device-specific addressing.

0xE7.name: MFR_SPECIAL_ID
0xE7.description:
Manufacturer code representing IC
silicon and revision

0xE9.name: MFR_IIN_OFFSET_1
0xE9.description:
Coefficient used in calculations of
READ_IIN and MFR_READ_IIN_1 ,
representing the contribution of
input current drawn by the control
IC, including the MOSFET drivers.
0xE9.default: 0x8BE7 (0.0305A), read/write, paged, stored in user-editable NVM.

0xEA.name: MFR_FAULT_LOG_STORE
0xEA.description:
Commands a transfer of the fault
log from RAM to EEPROM. This
causes the part to behave as if a
channel has faulted off.
0xEA.default:
Default value not applicable, send byte only, non-paged, not stored in
NVM.

0xEC.name: MFR_FAULT_LOG_CLEAR
0xEC.description:
Initialize the EEPROM block
reserved for fault logging and
clear any previous fault logging
locks.
0xEC.default:
Default value not applicable, send byte only, non-paged, not stored in
NVM.

0xED.name: MFR_READ_IIN_1
0xED.default: Default value not applicable, read-only, paged, not stored in NVM.

0xEE.name: MFR_FAULT_LOG
0xEE.description:
Fault log data bytes. This
sequentially retrieved data is used
to assemble a complete fault log.
0xEE.default:
Default value not applicable, read-only, non-paged, stored in fault-log
NVM.

0xEF.name: MFR_COMMON
0xEF.description:
Manufacturer status bits that are
common across multiple ADI ICs/
modules.
0xEF.default: Default value not applicable, read-only, non-paged, not stored in NVM.

0xF0.name: MFR_COMPARE_USER_ALL
0xF0.description:
Compares current command
contents (RAM) with NVM.
0xF0.default:
Default value not applicable, send byte only, non-paged, not stored in
NVM.

0xF4.name: MFR_TEMPERATURE_2_PEAK
0xF4.description:
Maximum measured control IC
junction temperature since last
MFR_CLEAR_PEAKS.
0xF4.default: Default value not applicable, read-only, non-paged, not stored in NVM.

0xF5.name: MFR_PWM_CONFIG_*
0xF5.description:
Configuration bits for setting
the phase interleaving angles of
Channels 0 and 1, SHARE_CLK
behavior in UVLO, and using
the fully differential amplifier
to regulate paralleled output
channels.
0xF5.default:
0x10, read/write, non-paged, stored in user-editable NVM. When bit 7 is
0_{b} , Channel 1's output is regulated by the V_{OSNS1} and SGND feedback
signals. When bit 7 is 1_{b} , Channel 1's output is regulated by the V_{OSNS0} +
and V_{OSNS0} – feedback signals. Only set bit 7 to 1_{b} for PolyPhase rail
applications. The command is named MFR_PWM_CONFIG and referred to
as MFR_PWM_CONFIG_LTM467X in LTpowerPlay.

0xF6.name: MFR_IOUT_CAL_GAIN_TC_1
0xF6.description:
Temperature coefficient of the
current sensing element.
0xF6.default: 0x0F14 (3860ppm/°C), read/write, paged, stored in user-editable NVM.

0xF8.name: MFR_TEMP_1_GAIN_1
0xF8.description:
Sets the slope of the temperature
sensors that interface to TSNS_{na} .
0xF8.default:
0x3FAE (0.995, in custom units), read/write, paged, stored in user-editable
NVM.

0xF9.name: MFR_TEMP_1_OFFSET_1

0xFA.name: MFR_RAIL_ADDRESS_1
0xFA.description:
Common address for PolyPhase
outputs to adjust common
parameters.

0xFD.name: MFR_RESET
0xFD.description:
Commanded reset without
requiring a power down.
0xFD.default:
Default value not applicable, send byte only, non-paged, not stored in
NVM. Identical to RESTORE_USER_ALL.
